title: Lit Audio UI Library: Core Setup & Porting
description: Surgically port the React/Tailwind/Radix audio components from sources/ui into a pure Lit WebComponents library.

title: Setup Foundation: Vite + Lit Project
description: Initialize a new Vite + Lit WebComponents package/directory for the audio UI components (e.g., `scream-ui/packages/lit-audio-ui` or just `scream-ui/lit-audio-ui`). Configure TypeScript, ESLint, and a basic index.html demo page.

title: Demo: Mic Selector
description: Add `<sui-mic-selector>` to the demo app. Prove it can request microphone permissions and display the available input hardware in the browser.

title: Port: Voice Picker
description: Port `voice-picker.tsx` to a native WebComponent (`<sui-voice-picker>`). This is a complex scrolling list with filtering and avatar components. Replace Tailwind layouts with scoped flex/grid CSS and Material list items.

title: Demo: Voice Picker
description: Add `<sui-voice-picker>` to the demo app with a list of mock voice personas to prove the complex CSS dropdown and filter states work natively in Lit.

title: Port: Scrolling Waveform
description: Port `ScrollingWaveform` from `waveform.tsx` to a native WebComponent (`<ui-scrolling-waveform>`). Implement the internal `requestAnimationFrame` loop and `speed` attribute to create an infinite, smooth-scrolling audio visualization without requiring a live AnalyserNode.

title: Feature: Component Showcase Card (Preview/Code)
description: Build a new Lit WebComponent (`<ui-showcase-card>`) to wrap demo elements. It should provide a Material Design tabbed interface (Preview / Code), allowing users to see the running component and seamlessly toggle to view its raw HTML source code, replacing the raw HTML cards in `index.html`.

title: Port: Shimmering Text
description: Port `shimmering-text.tsx` into a native WebComponent (`<ui-shimmering-text>`). Translate the Framer Motion linear gradient animations into pure CSS `@keyframes` and custom properties for a lightweight, dependency-free text loading effect.

title: Feature: Demo Page Side Navigation
description: Add a transparent-background, sticky left-hand navigation rail to `index.html`. It should automatically generate anchor links to every `<ui-showcase-card>` on the page, allowing users to quickly discover and jump to specific components.

title: Port: Audio Utilities (AudioContext & Canvas Math)
description: Extract the core audio processing logic from `sources/ui/apps/www/registry/elevenlabs-ui/ui/bar-visualizer.tsx` and related components. Create a shared pure TypeScript utility module (e.g., `audio-utils.ts`) for `createAudioAnalyser`, FFT logic, and canvas drawing functions.

title: Port: LiveWaveform & BarVisualizer (Canvas)
description:
Rewrite `live-waveform.tsx` and `bar-visualizer.tsx` into native Lit WebComponents (e.g., `<sui-live-waveform>`).

- Replace React `useRef` with `@query('canvas')`.
- Replace `useEffect` with `firstUpdated()` and `updated()`. 
- Use the extracted audio utilities.
- Inject the visualizer into the demo app to verify it matches the visual polish of the original.

title: Port: VoiceButton & AudioPlayer (Interactive Controls)
description:
Rewrite the stateful `voice-button.tsx` and `audio-player.tsx` components as Lit WebComponents.

- Replace Tailwind classes with scoped CSS and CSS Custom Properties for theming.
- Replace Radix sliders with Material Web `@material/web/slider/slider.js` or native `<input type=range>`.
- Implement local component states (idle, recording, processing, success, error) using Lit `@state()`.
- Integrate `live-waveform` and `waveform` into the `voice-button` component visually.

title: Port: 3D Orb Visualizer (WebGL / Three.js)
description:
Adapt the `orb.tsx` component from `@react-three/fiber` into a native Three.js + Lit WebComponent (`scream-orb.ts`).

- Re-implement the `useFrame` and `useTexture` hooks into a standard `requestAnimationFrame` loop and `THREE.TextureLoader`.
- Adapt the GLSL shaders and `MeshStandardMaterial` for the interactive thinking/listening/talking states.
- Match the existing architecture found in `../scream/frontend/src/three-audio-visualizer.ts`.

title: Demo: LiveWaveform & BarVisualizer
description: Add the LiveWaveform and BarVisualizer components to the demo app (index.html) with mock audio data/microphone input to visually verify them.

title: Demo: VoiceButton & AudioPlayer
description: Add the VoiceButton and AudioPlayer components to the demo app. Verify state changes (idle/recording/processing) and slider interactions.

title: Demo: 3D Orb Visualizer
description: Add the 3D Orb visualizer to the demo app. Verify the WebGL shaders and audio reactivity.

title: Port: Mic Selector
description: Port `mic-selector.tsx` to a native WebComponent (`<sui-mic-selector>`). Map the browser's `navigator.mediaDevices.enumerateDevices` to a Material Web `<md-menu>` or floating UI to select audio input devices.

title: Compound Audio Player Architecture
description: Refactor the monolithic audio player into a compound Web Component architecture using @lit/context. This provides atomic building blocks (play button, slider, time display) that can be composed into any layout.

title: Setup @lit/context and Audio Protocol
description: Install @lit/context and define the TypeScript interface and Context token for the shared Audio Player state (isPlaying, currentTime, duration, etc.) in `src/utils/audio-context.ts`.

title: Create Provider: <ui-audio-provider>
description: Build the orchestrator component `<ui-audio-provider>` that manages the hidden `<audio>` element, handles all browser media events, and uses `@provide({context: audioContext})` to broadcast state downwards to any child elements.

title: Create Atomic Consumers: Buttons & Sliders
description: Build the atomic UI components that consume the context: `<ui-audio-play-button>`, `<ui-audio-progress>`, `<ui-audio-time>`, and `<ui-audio-volume>`. Each should use `@consume({context: audioContext})` to update instantly.

title: Refactor Monolith: <ui-audio-player>
description: Refactor the existing monolithic `<ui-audio-player>` to internally use the new `<ui-audio-provider>` and its atomic children, ensuring backward compatibility while proving the composition model.

title: Demo: Complex Audio Player Layout
description: Build a new, highly custom audio player layout in the `index.html` demo to prove the power of the compound architecture. It should feature a completely different layout from the standard pill-shape.
